description: This is a common popular textbook for learning hiragana, katakana, and some kanji. You will gain a foundation of the language. Not entirely useful on its own.
This a textbook containing thousands of kanji you may use in your life, including the everyday ones you need for proficiency. Useful for most Shi documents.
This a textbook containing archaic Japanese kanji and phrases that most speakers may not even know. Only critical for understanding older texts, or heavily encrypted Shi documents.

This is an encrypted set of documents bearing the Kanji character for Death, with emphasis on the four. You would need to be proficient at Japanese to decrypt this. The images show this will teach you Essence Theory.

This is an encrypted set of documents bearing the Kanji character for Death, with emphasis on the four. You would need to be proficient at Japanese to decrypt this. The images show this will teach you Essence Technology

This is an encrypted set of documents bearing the Kanji character for Death, with emphasis on the four. You would need to be an expert at Japanese to decrypt this. This appears to be a lineup of Arakawa equipment, a clan which values raw firepower over all else.

This is an encrypted set of documents bearing the Kanji character for Death, with emphasis on the four. You would need to be an expert at Japanese to decrypt this. This appears to be a lineup of Seburo equipment, a clan which values sustained rate of firepower from lower caliber ammunition while maintaining accuracy.

This is an encrypted set of documents bearing the Kanji character for Death, with emphasis on the four. You would need to be an expert at Japanese to decrypt this. This appears to be a lineup of Ishikawa equipment, a clan which values precision strikes and perfect accuracy.

This is an encrypted set of documents bearing the Kanji character for Death, with emphasis on the four. On top of using military grade ciphers you predict you'll need a mastery of Japanese and knowledge of computers to crack this. The Kawakami clan rarely build anything, but make powerful purpose-built wildcards.

This is an encrypted set of documents bearing the Kanji character for Death, with emphasis on the four.  You need to be proficient at Japanese to decrypt this. The Kawakami clan emblem is there alongside pictures of plants, maybe the Imperials think its medical research.

This is an encrypted set of documents bearing the red Imperial emblem of a walled city with four gates, they use cipher keys generated from officer datapads to decrypt their papers in field. This contains manufacturing knowledge from Edmund Ordnance, a common ballistics manufacturer owned by General Duke and his family.

This is an encrypted set of documents bearing the red Imperial emblem of a walled city with four gates, they use cipher keys generated from officer datapads to decrypt their papers in field. This contains manufacturing knowledge from Krupp works, the only company that survived the apocalypse of 2125. They're known for lasers and very little else.

This is an encrypted set of documents bearing the Imperial emblem of justice which represents Arbiters. They are an elite mage unit with the individual power to be classified as regiments or living tanks, they use advanced encryption implanted directly into their cybernetic implants. Arbiters manufacture their own secret equipment with the help of all other branches and companies.

This is an encrypted set of documents bearing the red Imperial emblem of a walled city with four gates, they use cipher keys generated from officer datapads to decrypt their papers in field. This contains manufacturing knowledge from Golem Arms, known for simplistic, high durability weapons that never break and often have nasty surprises.

This is an encrypted set of documents bearing the emblem of the Chemical Warfare corps, the Imperial division for handling mutants and essence technology. They use advanced encryption implanted directly into their cybernetic implants. Whilst the name of the division is a lie, you will still find chemical weapons in here.
These decrypted documents will teach you the theories and origin of Essence, how to extract it and how to harness its power.
These decrypted documents will teach you how to use Essence for machinery from the viewpoint of the Shi
These documents contain blueprints and design specifications for the few things that either XEDRA or the Imperials managed to reverse-engineer from the Shi.

This is a report detailing prevailing theories on the current extra-dimensional travel XEDRA was doing, and the exotic materials they've collected. It details a warning that a hostile human empire from a far-future dimension may invade if XEDRA's presence is discovered.
These decrypted documents will teach you how to manufacture Arakawa equipment.
These decrypted documents will teach you how to manufacture Seburo equipment.
These decrypted documents will teach you how to manufacture Ishikawa equipment.
It took you a long time to decrypt these messy ramblings but you already note some exotic designs, like a 40mm assault rifle and a 50 BMG autopistol.
It's a fucking COOKBOOK! These recipes look bad and are personalized for the creator's taste, someone got tricked into collecting these papers. Somehow, Somewhere, you hear laughter.
These decrypted documents will teach you how to manufacture Edmund Ordnance equipment, a common ballistics manufacturer owned by General Duke and his family.
These decrypted documents will teach you how to manufacture Krupp Works equipment, the only company that survived the apocalypse of 2125. They're known for lasers and very little else.
These decrypted documents will teach you Arbiter secrets. Arbiters are the elite mage unit of the Imperial government.
These decrypted documents will teach you how to manufacture Golem Arms equipment. They are known for simplistic, high durability weapons that never break and often have nasty surprises.
These decrypted documents will teach you CWC secrets, the Imperial division for handling mutants and essence technology.
